meanings.definition: To slide on the tail of an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The pilot tailslides the plane during the airshow.
meanings.sent2: The aircraft tailslides gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic accidentally tailslides while trying to fix the tail of the plane.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement tailslides like a plane taking off for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The children watch in awe as the plane tailslides through the clouds.

meanings.definition: A maneuver in which an aircraft slides on its tail.
meanings.sent1: The tailslides of the aircraft require skill and precision.
meanings.sent2: During the show, the pilot performed a perfect tailslide.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected tailslide of the plane surprised the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The tailslide of the aircraft was like a dance in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The tailslide left a lasting impression on everyone who witnessed it.

meanings.definition: The act of sliding on the tail of an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The tailslides of the aircraft are thrilling to watch.
meanings.sent2: The tailslide is a popular maneuver among skilled pilots.
meanings.sent3: During the competition, the pilot's tailslide drew cheers from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The graceful tailslide of the plane was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The tailslide maneuver requires precise control and timing.
